data.title: Woman arrested in Taylor Swift ticket fraud case: Toronto police
data.description: Toronto police have arrested a GTA woman who they allege scammed dozens of Taylor Swift fans out of nearly $70,000 by promising them tickets that never materialized.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: Trudeau to meet with premiers as Trump threatens hefty tariffs on Canadian goods
data.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says he’s agreed to meet with his provincial and territorial counterparts after Donald Trump threatened to impose hefty tariffs on Canadian goods.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: Veteran Edmonton actor Julien Arnold dies during performance at Citadel Theatre
data.description: Edmonton actor Julien Arnold died on Sunday night after a medical emergency during a performance of A Christmas Carol at the Citadel Theatre.
data.author: Author 2

data.title: Beef prices hit record high at the grocery store — and on the ranch too
data.description: The cost of ground beef, steak and roasts has continued to rise this year, reaching historic levels on grocery store shelves.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: What exactly is a tariff? What you need to know about Trump's newest threat
data.description: Donald Trump has threatened to impose a 25 per cent tariff on all products entering the country from Canada and Mexico on his first day in office. We break down what that means, and how it could affect you.
data.author: Author 3

data.title: Netanyahu says he supports ceasefire proposal with Lebanon's Hezbollah
data.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that he would recommend his cabinet adopt a U.S.-brokered ceasefire agreement with Lebanon's Hezbollah, as Israeli warplanes struck across Lebanon, killing at least 23 people.
data.author: Author 4

data.title: Study finds Indigenous people cultivated hazelnuts 7,000 years ago, challenging modern assumptions
data.description: A new study indicates Indigenous peoples in what is now British Columbia have been cultivating the beaked hazelnut for thousands of years, challenging assumptions that pre-colonial Indigenous people were only hunter-gatherers.
data.author: Author 4

data.title: How Canadian encrypted phones became coveted tools for criminals around the world
data.description: Criminals around the world using Canadian encrypted phones thought they were operating under the radar. But European police managed to intercept their messages and crack the code, leading to thousands of convictions. Radio-Canada’s Enquête reveals how some of the Vancouver company’s top distributors of the Sky ECC phones were connected to the criminal underworld.
data.author: Author 4

data.title: U.S. President Donald Trump arrives in Qatar for 2nd stop in his diplomatic tour
data.description: U-S President Donald Trump is now in Qatar - for the second stop of his Middle East tour.
data.author: Author 4

data.title: Ellen Fairclough: The first woman to become a federal cabinet minister
data.description: Ellen Fairclough became the first woman appointed to a federal cabinet position by John Diefenbaker in 1957. The Progressive Conservative MP served as secretary of state, became the minister of citizenship and immigration the following year and served as Canada first female acting prime minister for two days in February 1958.
data.author: Author 3

data.title: Quebec seeks to regulate doctors' salaries to encourage them to take on more patients
data.description: The province health minister has tabled a bill that would give the Quebec government the authority to regulate how health professionals are paid, with the goal of getting them to take on more patients. Doctors are pushing back.
data.author: Author 2

data.title: Winnipeg city councillor raises concerns about potential fire threats
data.description: A fire tore through an industrial area along Gunn Road in Winnipeg Transcona neighbourhood on Monday, sending up plumes of black smoke and triggering explosions at an auto parts business. While no injuries were reported, the blaze has exposed safety concerns. One city councillor is now calling the site a 'ticking time bomb,' warning that it's only a matter of time before a more catastrophic incident occurs.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: Mark Carney unveils his crisis cabinet
data.description: Standing outside Rideau Hall on Tuesday, Mark Carney said his new cabinet — the first real cabinet of his time as prime minister — was "purpose-built for this hinge moment." It was perhaps a more hopeful way of saying "crisis" — or an overlapping series of crises, like what the prime minister and his new cabinet now face.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: Crown re-questions woman in sex assault trial of ex-world junior hockey players after marathon cross-exams
data.description: We're back at Superior Court in London, Ont., to bring you the latest updates from the ongoing trial of five former world junior hockey players.
data.author: Author 2

data.title: Toronto mayor calls for financial support fighting rising costs, in letter to Carney
data.description: Toronto Mayor Olivia Chow called on the federal government for support in fighting a “deepening” affordability crisis and investing in transit, in a letter to Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney.
data.author: Author 5

data.title: The great bike lane debate in northeast Edmonton
data.description: Local podcast hears how construction is putting a stick in the spokes for local residents
data.author: Author 2

data.title: About That
data.description: CBC's Andrew Chang finds the awesome in daily news by expanding our understanding of the stories everybody's talking about. We dig deep with a clear focus, a sense of wonder and will geek out, laugh, and admit when we don’t get it.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: Delay in renewing Ontario water testing program leaves participants on edge
data.description: A volunteer-led program that helps monitor the health of hundreds of lakes across Ontario has been on hold because agreement with the province has not yet been renewed.
data.author: Author 2

data.title: Putin has more to gain by not showing up to ceasefire talks, Russia watchers say
data.description: Ukraine and Russia will meet for direct peace talks in Istanbul on Thursday, but Putin may not show.
data.author: Author 1

data.title: Adult in critical condition after being struck by vehicle near Trainyards
data.description: An adult is in critical condition after being struck by a vehicle near the Trainyards shopping centre on Wednesday, according to the Ottawa Paramedic Service.
data.author: Author 3

data.title: Sault Ste. Marie just the latest northern Ontario municipality to consider the OPP in order to save money
data.description: Many towns and cities across northeastern Ontario have their eye on Sault Ste. Marie, as that city considers a switch to provincial police.
data.author: Author 4

data.title: Ontario electricity produced with rising percentage of greenhouse-gas-emitting power
data.description: Ontario's electricity is now being produced with the highest percentage of greenhouse-gas-emitting power since coal plants were operating in the province.
data.author: Author 3

data.title: Ford reacts as Honda pauses EV project amid Trump's tariffs
data.description: Honda is postponing plans to build an EV supply chain in Alliston, Ont., for about two years. The news comes as U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs create uncertainty across the industry and as demand for electric vehicles declines.
data.author: Author 2
